page.title: 17EDUCATION
page.content: THE MAJORITY OF THE CHILDREN IN THE VILLAGE ATTEND THE VILLAGE SCHOOL SITUATED AT A CROSSROADS SOME QUARTER OF A MILE OUTSIDE THE CONURBATION ON THE FURTHEST POINT OF WHAT WAS ONCE COMMON LAND.THE SCHOOL,IN RECENT YEARS HAS AVERAGED 40 PUPILS IN THE AGE RANGE FIVE TO ELEVEN YEARS,TAUGHT IN TWO CLASSES WITH TWO FULL TIME TEACHERS AND ONE PART TIME TEACHER ATTENDING FOR ONE DAY WEEKLY. THE ORIGINAL MAIN BUILDING DATES FROM THE 1840'S AND NOW FUNCTIONS AS A HALL AND OFFICES,THE TEACHING TAKING PLACE IN A' TEMPORARY'WOODEN BUILDING HOUSING TWO CLASSROOMS, WHILST MEALS ARE SERVED IN A HORSA CANTEEN BUILDING. AT ELEVEN YEARS PUPILS TRANSFER TO HOMEWOOD SCHOOL TENTERDEN.
